text: the marionettes hi everyone anthony
fantano here the internet's busiest
music nerd and it's time for a review of
the new marionettes marionettes lp hit
the waves these guys are a swedish pop
and rock outfit this is their third full
length lp
and on this release they're sticking
with roughly the same sound that they've
been
purveyors of for a majority of their
career let's just say the marionettes
aren't exactly well known for their
originality if you give a listen to this
lp pretty much what you're going to get
is
80s era dream and jangle pop with a
hefty helping of synthesizers on the
side a lot of danceable beats on this lp
explosive hooks and very very emotive
vocals from front man philip eckstrom
who a lot of the time vocally is a dead
ringer for the cures robert smith and
though the cure is a huge influence on
the marionette's music it's not really
like the more post-punky goth abrasive
side of the band really sort of comes
out in this record it's really more of a
cross breed of robert smith's vocals
along with these sort of light poppy
catchy but sort of you know single-tier
streaming down my face vibe that you
typically get from like a smith's record
so the marionettes have some really
obvious influences but on every single
one of their records they always manage
to at least dish out a few infectiously
awesome tracks now on this third album
of theirs i can't exactly say they're
doing much of anything new they pretty
much come through with the same sound
that they've always had maybe there's a
little more synthesizers in the mix but
still the marionettes can come off a
little one-dimensional at times even
though that's the case and they kind of
drown in their influences a little bit i
do think this record has the most
consecutively catchy and sharp and
well-written tracks that the marianas
have put together so far from the start
of the first track on this thing it
becomes very clear that the marionettes
are not a very modern band there is a
huge sense of nostalgia that just
bashes me over the head as i listen
through this record which maybe was not
as strong in their previous stuff they
really kind of ham it up on this new
album especially with some of the synth
tones like for example the song evil
coast once the bouncy echoed guitars and
the epic floor tom drumming and the
chili synthesizers come in on this track
it's 80s 80s 80s 80s and while a lot of
these tracks are very basic and sort of
straightforward in terms of just kind of
a verse chorus verse sort of thing
they're all beautifully produced the
colors are really heavenly they're
blissful they're pretty on the ears and
most definitely the marionettes will
appeal to people who loved not just the
cure but some of the more mainstream
acts in new wave music as well like when
the track hit the waves the title track
on this lp comes through the song is
incredibly upbeat i love the hook on
this thing hit the way
it's honestly one of the best and
sexiest pop grooves i've heard on a
verse this year and it just totally
screams like toto to me i'm feeling
totally toto on this track the song
years also is kind of a slow burn or has
a sensual
sexy groove to it and yeah even though
phillips vocals sound just like robert
smith's he hooks me in with his freaking
refrains
stay away stay away on this record these
guys are so die hard passionate about
trying to recapture this old school 80s
synth pop production sound it almost
feels as true to detail as like an
aerial pink tune but in this case
there's no tongue in no cheek not a
single ounce of irony leaks into any one
of these songs they're all very
heartfelt they're all very
sincere don't forget don't forget
however i do kind of feel that this lp
falls apart at the tail end to an extent
through a handful of tracks the really
atmospheric and slow-moving closer is
pretty on the ears but kind of
an underwhelming climax and a few other
tracks like unblessed and can't stop the
aching are jangle pop tunes jangle rock
tunes but the melodies that they use the
guitar leads on these tracks are just a
little too
obvious not only do the marionettes feel
like they're ripping off the sounds of
other bands on these particular tracks
but they almost feel like carbon copies
of songs i've already heard in the genre
as well plus there is the issue that
it's been a while since the band has put
out their last lp and they've only
managed to drum up really nine new
tracks overall i did like this lp it was
a fun sweet catchy pop album with just a
lot of infectious a lot of contagious
choruses a lot of nice grooves great
production however the marionettes
continue to drown in their influences
and don't work with them in a way that
feels refreshing or all that
constructive really and at this point
the question kind of comes up if this is
always going to be the case for the
marionettes i'm feeling a strong six to
a light seven on this lp if you're into
pop music if you're in a dream pop
jangle pop you want something concise
straightforward it's just gonna hit you
and stick in your head and then leave
then give this album a listen okay
okay
love you
anthony fantano
marionettes forever
